dmTitle.infoName: Default business rules exchange data module

proceduralStep.title: Converter Housing Seal Replacement
proceduralStep.para: This procedure contains the instructions for the replacement of a leaky converter housing metallic seal. If cartridge replacement is to be accomplished concurrently, refer to the Planned Maintenance System. Converter (CNV-365B)Illustrated parts diagram, provides an illustrated breakdown of the component to assist the operator.
Perform the preliminary actions to access the converter housing refer to Converter (CNV-365B)Open for access procedure and Converter (CNV-365B)Open for access procedure).
Isolate the ASU from the BMP as follows:
Lower the level in the ASU tank to less than 50 percent full.
Align the ILPE to operate with the BMP secured (refer to paragraph 2.4.8.2).

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Oxidizer(s) must be operational or the ship must be surface ventilating prior to inboard venting of the recycle loop. Recycle gases are combustible.

proceduralStep.para: Shut manual valve MV-910A.
Vent the BMP to ambient (refer to paragraph 2.4.9.1).
Disconnect fitting F23 from the ASU and install the test cap and plug (cap and plug are stored on face of ASU).Torqueto 54 -67 ft-lb.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Converter housing may be hot. Exercise caution to prevent burns.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Carefully monitor ASU tank level and pressure, making sure it stays below 1000 psig. A burst rupture disk in the ASU will vent gas to the BMP if F23 is not capped. Due to this risk, it is recommended that the operator have adequate ventilation in the AMR, have a breathing mask available, and be prepared to have the ASU contents dumped overboard.

proceduralStep.para: Deactivate the catalyst in accordance with paragraph 2.4.9.4.
ove the converter housing top insulation blanket. Retain for reuse.

note.notePara: If an eyebolt is not installed, coat the thread bearing surfaces of the lifting eyebolt (CP032-401) with MOLYKOTE P-37 lubricant or an approved lubricant and install on the cover. Torque to 9.5 - 11.5 ft-lb.

proceduralStep.para: Verify lifting eyebolt (CP032-401) is installed in converter cover.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Do not move converter housing cover without assistance. The cover weighs approximately 200 pounds.

proceduralStep.para: Remove the converter housing cover as follows:

note.notePara: Some ships have torque nuts securing converter housing cover instead of standard nuts. Use alternate torque nut removal procedure.

proceduralStep.para: Remove the nuts from the converter housing cover.
Alternate torque nut removal procedure:

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Fastener removal must follow this procedure. Unloading jackbolts prematurely or out of sequence will cause remaining jackbolts to carry full load leading to jackbolt damage.

proceduralStep.para: Loosen jackbolts 1/8 turn following a circular pattern around each torque nut. Perform this on all torque nuts.
Repeat step a for all torque nuts, loosing jackbolts 1/4 turn. Repeat this step as required until all jackbolts are loose.
Attach the lifting ring (part of the lifting arm) to the GPU frame.
Attach one end of a lifting device to lifting ring located on frame above converter, and the other to the converter housing cover lifting eyebolt.
Carefully remove the converter housing cover, keeping the cover level to prevent binding of the bolts. Set the cover aside on something soft (cardboard, rags, etc).
Remove the metallic compression gasket from the converter housing and discard.
Visually inspect the bolts for damage. Refer to Converter housing flange boltChange = Remove and install a new item of flange bolt(s) require replacement.
Install the metallic compression gasket in the converter housing as follows:
Clean the top surface of the converter housing using a soft cloth and warm potable water.
Inspect the new metallic compression gasket for damage.
Carefully place the metallic compression gasket into the sealing groove on the converter housing.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Do not move converter housing cover without assistance. The cover weighs approximately 200 pounds.

proceduralStep.para: Install the converter housing cover as follows:
Clean the sealing surface of the cover.
Attach the lifting arm hook to the converter housing cover and carefully set the cover in place.
Remove the lifting arm hook from the converter housing cover eyebolt.
Remove the lifting arm and lifting ring from the GPU frame.
Light coat the threads of the converter housing bolts with MOLYKOTE P-37 lubricant or an approved lubricant.

note.notePara: Some ships have torque nuts securing converter housing cover instead of standard nuts. Use alternate torque nut tightening procedure.

proceduralStep.para: Install the housing cover nuts. Torque to 290 - 300 ft-lb in a diametrically opposite pattern.
Alternate torque nut tightening procedure:
Ensure jackbolts are flush or recessed into torque nut
Slide washer over T-Bolt until flush with cover
Spin torque nut onto T-Bolt thread until it seats against the washer.
Tighten four jackbolts as close to 90 degrees apart as possible on all 14 T-Bolts. Torque jackbolts to 45 in-lb at this time.
When all 14 T-Bolts have been tightened, repeat step d on the same jackbolts and torque to 90 in-lb.

Torque all 10 jackbolts on each torque nut to 90 in-lb in a circular pattern. Torque each jackbolt once then move to the next T-Bolt/torque nut. T-Bolt/torquenuts should be tightened in a crossing pattern. This process may require 2-4 passes around the converter cover until all jackbolts are at final torque.
Position the insulation blanket on the top of the converter housing cover.
Align the ASU to the BMP as follows:
Carefully remove the test cap (cap and plug store on the face of ASU) from bulkhead fitting F23 and install the line leading to the BMP.
Open manual valve MV-910A.
Activate the BMP and perform the steps to return the ILPE to an operational condition refer to Converter (CNV-365B)Close after access procedure and Converter (CNV-365B)Close after access procedure).
